result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden L. Proulx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Counts 2 & 3, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Branden L. Proulx in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.

State moves to amend count 3 to a misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 1 - 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1 - 3.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to counts 2 & 3.
STAYED.
  
Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Concurrent to counts 2 & 3.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as Condition of Probation.


Count 2:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to counts 1 & 3.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Concurrent to counts 1 & 3.
Conditions of Probation:
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as Condition of Probation.



Count 3:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Concurrent to counts 1 & 2.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Concurrent to counts 1 & 2.
Conditions of Probation:
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED.
To be used at agent's discretion.

Defendant Branden L. Proulx in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Branden L. Proulx in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program today.

Defendant Branden L. Proulx in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Amended Criminal Complaint filed with the clerks office on 10/1/14.
